triples.evidence: These tests revealed that ambient vibration inherent in a world-class, raised floor data center caused performance degradation of up to 246% for random reads and up to 88% degradation for random writes for an enterprise class storage system.

mappings.label: Vibration
mappings.notes: Vibration is explicitly mentioned as an external factor affecting performance.

mappings.notes: Random access pattern is explicitly tested and mentioned in the paper.

mappings.notes: Read-heavy workload is implied by the focus on random reads.

mappings.label: Performance
mappings.notes: Performance degradation is a general term encompassing various metrics.

mappings.label: IOPS
mappings.notes: IOPS is a specific performance metric affected by vibration.
